title: Bukit Gantang MP repeats claim seven or eight from PN will declare support for Anwar's govt soon
summary: Bukit Gantang Member of Parliament Datuk Syed Abu Hussin Hafiz Syed Abdul Fasal on Saturday repeated his claim that seven to eight MPs from the opposition will declare their support for Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim’s government.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 6): Bukit Gantang Member of Parliament Datuk Syed Abu Hussin Hafiz Syed Abdul Fasal on Saturday repeated his claim that seven to eight MPs from the opposition will declare their support for Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim’s government.

The Bersatu MP added that the MPs will declare their support when Parliament reconvenes at the end of February.

“It's still relevant (the earlier statement)...[they are] just

title: Employers who deceive foreign workers face blacklisting, business ban — ministers
summary: Employers who deceive foreign workers into securing non-existent jobs in Pengerang, Johor will be blacklisted and barred from conducting any business activities, including renewing temporary employment visit passes for their current workers at the Immigration Department.
content:
PUTRAJAYA (Jan 6): Employers who deceive foreign workers into securing non-existent jobs in Pengerang, Johor will be blacklisted and barred from conducting any business activities, including renewing temporary employment visit passes for their current workers at the Immigration Department.

Home Minister Datuk Seri Saifuddin Nasution Ismail and Human Resources Minister Steven Sim Chee Keong in a joint statement on Saturday said the employers involved would also be blacklisted from applying for ne

title: Socso contributions for media practitioners, including stringers, need to be expedited, says Fahmi
summary: Social Security Organisation (Socso) contributions for media practitioners, especially for stringers (part-time or freelance journalists), need to be expedited, Communications Minister Fahmi Fadzil said on Saturday.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 6): Social Security Organisation (Socso) contributions for media practitioners, especially for stringers (part-time or freelance journalists), need to be expedited, Communications Minister Fahmi Fadzil said on Saturday.

He added that this would allow them to obtain benefits from Socso, including death and disability benefits, that would offer better protections.

"We need to champion and ensure that media friends, both full-timer and part-t

title: Johari Ghani wants stern action against companies failing to provide jobs for foreign workers
summary: Plantation and Commodities Minister Datuk Seri Johari Abdul Ghani has reiterated his call to the government to take stern measures against companies that mislead foreign workers with employment offers, and then abandon them once they get in Malaysia.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 6): Plantation and Commodities Minister Datuk Seri Johari Abdul Ghani has reiterated his call to the government to take stern measures against companies that mislead foreign workers with employment offers, and then abandon them once they get in Malaysia.

He said to prevent Malaysia from becoming known as a refuge for forced labour and human trafficking, the government must address the persistent problem.

While breaking down the problems su

title: Sultan Ibrahim: No audiences until inauguration as Yang di-Pertuan Agong on Jan 31
summary: Sultan of Johor Sultan Ibrahim Almarhum Sultan Iskandar has decreed that he will not grant any audience starting from now until his inauguration as the Yang di-Pertuan Agong on Jan 31.
content:
JOHOR BAHRU (Jan 6): Sultan of Johor Sultan Ibrahim Almarhum Sultan Iskandar has decreed that he will not grant any audience starting from now until his inauguration as the Yang di-Pertuan Agong on Jan 31.

His Majesty said, however, there will be an exception for previously scheduled events, and the weekly audiences with the Johor menteri besar as well as the state government.

“From today onwards, until I take my oath as the Yang di

title: Housing developers in S'wak no longer obligated to construct affordable homes, says premier
summary: Private housing developers planning on developing large-scale projects in Sarawak are no longer required to build affordable homes starting from the first quarter of this year, Sarawak Premier Tan Sri Abang Johari Tun Openg said.
content:
KUCHING (Jan 6): Private housing developers planning on developing large-scale projects in Sarawak are no longer required to build affordable homes starting from the first quarter of this year, Sarawak Premier Tan Sri Abang Johari Tun Openg said.

Instead, he said developers involved in projects that span 10 acres (4.05 hectares) or more are required to make compensation in lieu through a housing trust fund, which would allow the state government to use these funds for the development of affordable ho

title: SC adds two entities to Investor Alert List
summary: The Securities Commission Malaysia (SC) has updated its Investor Alert List.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 6): The Securities Commission Malaysia (SC) has updated its Investor Alert List.

In an alert on Friday, the commission said the following persons/entities were added to the list:

  • Master Binary/Sahabat Trader Binary

The Investor Alert List contains a list of unauthorised websites, investment products, companies and individuals, including:

  • Persons car

title: Warning of continuous heavy rain in Pahang, Johor until Sunday
summary: The Malaysian Meteorological Department (MetMalaysia) on Saturday issued a warning of continuous heavy rain for eastern Pahang and Johor until Sunday.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 6): The Malaysian Meteorological Department (MetMalaysia) on Saturday issued a warning of continuous heavy rain for eastern Pahang and Johor until Sunday.

In a statement issued on Saturday, it also said there would also be strong winds and rough seas until Monday.

This, it said follows the concentration of easterly winds expected to occur in Pahang, Johor, Sarawak and eastern Sabah until Tuesday.

title: Agro Madani sales programme recorded RM93.7 million in sales last year
summary: The Agro Madani sale organised by the Ministry of Agriculture and Food Security last year recorded sales amounting to RM93.7 million and involved the participation of 74,800 entrepreneurs.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 6): The Agro Madani sale organised by the Ministry of Agriculture and Food Security last year recorded sales amounting to RM93.7 million and involved the participation of 74,800 entrepreneurs.

Deputy Minister of Agriculture and Food Security Datuk Arthur Joseph Kurup said the programme was held at 5,608 locations, which exceeded the target of 5,000 locations, and attracted 2.9 million visitors.

"This programme indirectly increased the inco

title: The Risk Factor: The growing risk of global disorder
summary:
The Western-led global economic order had a bad year in 2023. Surprisingly, the primary cause was not the emergence of an alternative order led by China, as some had anticipated. Instead, it was internal stress that led to more doubts around the world about its effectiveness and legitimacy.

content:
This article first appeared in Forum, The Edge Malaysia Weekly on December 25, 2023 - January 7, 2024

The Western-led global economic order had a bad year in 2023. Surprisingly, the primary cause was not the emergence of an alternative order led by China, as some had anticipated. Instead, it was internal stress that led to more doubts around the world about its effectiveness and legitimacy.

title: Tiong denies drinking alcohol, eating pork in office
summary: Tourism, Arts and Culture Minister Datuk Seri Tiong King Sing has challenged those spreading allegations on WhatsApp that he consumed alcohol and ate pork in his office to come forward and meet him in person.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 6): Tourism, Arts and Culture Minister Datuk Seri Tiong King Sing has challenged those spreading allegations on WhatsApp that he consumed alcohol and ate pork in his office to come forward and meet him in person.

In a statement on Facebook, Tiong said he did not rule out the possibility of taking legal action to prevent such accusations from being made in the future.

“Baseless accusations like these must be strongly condemned. I have alway

summary:

title: Three media practitioners on remand for trespassing into Selangor MB's official residence
summary: The police obtained a remand order against three media practitioners for allegedly trespassing into the official residence of the Selangor menteri besar on Friday.
content:
SHAH ALAM (Jan 6): The police obtained a remand order against three media practitioners for allegedly trespassing into the official residence of the Selangor menteri besar on Friday.

Shah Alam district police chief ACP Mohd Iqbal Ibrahim said the remand order against the three suspects, who were arrested on Friday, was for two days until Sunday.

He said the investigation will be conducted under Section 447 of the Penal Code for criminal trespassing, which p

title: Capital A’s Fernandes plans to leave role within five years — report
summary: Capital A Bhd chief executive officer Tan Sri Tony Fernandes intends to leave his current role within five years, including with its budget carrier AirAsia, The Star reported.
content:
(Jan 6): Capital A Bhd chief executive officer Tan Sri Tony Fernandes intends to leave his current role within five years, including with its budget carrier AirAsia, The Star reported.

Fernandes said the start of 2024 is “definitely my last five years” before moving on to an advisory capacity, the paper cited him as saying in an interview. 

He plans to be based mainly in the group’s corporate office in Kuala Lumpur, where the logistics, travel

title: Business of sports: Rahm coup could be game changer and the PGA Tour has only itself to blame
summary: It always seemed an unlikely battleground. Manicured lawns. Strictly observed etiquette. Rules that have stood the test of time. Play conducted in a sepulchral hush. And if there were any issues, the 19th hole was the ideal place to hear them out. The royal and ancient game of golf had been all a...

title: Double cover: Sime Darby firing on all three cylinders + four major factors that will influence the market in 2024
summary: Over the years, as the dynamics of its major markets changed, Sime Darby Bhd’s operations in China and Australia have eclipsed those at home in Malaysia. Nevertheless, the recent acquisition of a majority stake in UMW Holdings Bhd is expected to raise the contribution of its operations in Malaysia.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 6): Over the years, as the dynamics of its major markets changed, Sime Darby Bhd’s operations in China and Australia have eclipsed those at home in Malaysia. Nevertheless, the recent acquisition of a majority stake in UMW Holdings Bhd is expected to raise the contribution of its operations in Malaysia.

With UMW Group becoming part of the group, Sime Darby’s Malaysian operations look set to become as significant as its Chinese and Australian businesses, allowing the group to fire all

title: Bursa expected to trend higher in 1,470-1,500 range in coming week
summary: Bursa Malaysia is expected to trend higher next week, moving in the 1,470-1,500 range on persistent optimism for the local bourse.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 6): Bursa Malaysia is expected to trend higher next week, moving in the 1,470-1,500 range on persistent optimism for the local bourse.

Rakuten Trade equity research vice-president Thong Pak Leng said fuelled by favourable market indicators, the FBM KLCI is forecast to remain above the 1,465 level for an extended period, a threshold it struggled to maintain several times last year.

title: Tentative trading of ringgit seen next week
summary: Trading of the ringgit is expected to remain cautious next week, with all eyes on major data points such as the US non-farm payroll (NFP) data, which will be critical for US dollar-ringgit performance.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 6): Trading of the ringgit is expected to remain cautious next week, with all eyes on major data points such as the US non-farm payroll (NFP) data, which will be critical for US dollar-ringgit performance.

Bank Muamalat Malaysia Bhd chief economist Dr Mohd Afzanizam Abdul Rashid said trading of the ringgit would be tentative next week.

“Should the NFP data turn out to be better than expected, the ringgit could stay weak next week

title: Digital infrastructure fast becoming cornerstone to achieve competitive advantage, says Equinix
summary: Digital infrastructure is quickly becoming a cornerstone for businesses to achieve a competitive advantage and succeed in an increasingly important digital economy.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 6): Digital infrastructure is quickly becoming a cornerstone for businesses to achieve a competitive advantage and succeed in an increasingly important digital economy.

In an email interview, Equinix managing director for Malaysia Cheam Tat Inn said that the ascent of artificial intelligence (AI) in Malaysia is reshaping industries, generating fresh opportunities for businesses and individuals.

title: Wall St Week Ahead-High market hopes raise stakes for US stocks
summary: Investors’ hopes are running high to start 2024, which could set up US stocks for a rocky stretch if some expectations are not met.
content:
NEW YORK: Investors’ hopes are running high to start 2024, which could set up US stocks for a rocky stretch if some expectations are not met.

Despite a shaky start to the year, the S&P 500 stands only around 2% below a fresh record high. Most investors have maintained a rosy view on everything from the US economy and corporate profits to the Federal Reserve’s monetary policy trajectory.

title: Oil prices settle higher on Middle East tensions
summary: Oil prices settled higher on Friday as US Secretary of State Antony Blinken began a week-long sweep through the Middle East in an attempt to contain regional tensions stoked by the Israel-Hamas conflict.
content:
Brent crude futures settled up US$1.17, or 1.51%, at US$78.76 a barrel. US West Texas Intermediate crude futures finished up US$1.62, or 2.24%, at US$73.81.

HOUSTON: Oil prices settled higher on Friday as US Secretary of State Antony Blinken began a week-long sweep through the Middle East in an attempt to contain regional tensions stoked by the Israel-Hamas conflict.

title: Writing his final chapter at AirAsia
summary: IT is a bittersweet moment for AirAsia founder Tan Sri Tony Fernandes as he looks out of his floor-to-ceiling window at the airline’s headquarters at Kuala Lumpur International Airport 2.
content:
Fernandes: To build an airline is tough, to rebuild an airline and build four other businesses, has been the ultimate challenge.

IT is a bittersweet moment for AirAsia founder Tan Sri Tony Fernandes as he looks out of his floor-to-ceiling window at the airline’s headquarters at Kuala Lumpur International Airport 2.

content:

summary: Investment holding company Global Oriental Bhd (GOB) has proposed to acquire the remaining 45% equity interest in Edisijuta Parking Sdn Bhd (EPSB) that it does not already own for RM22.5mil cash from Cahaya Impian Sdn Bhd.

content:

title: Construction industry margins to improve this year
summary: The construction industry’s margins are expected to improve in 2024 as older contracts with low margins tail off and new contracts with more normalised margins start to contribute, says Kenanga Research.
content:
Kenanga Research expects a fresh wave of public infrastructure projects to finally hit the market in 2024.

PETALING JAYA: The construction industry’s margins are expected to improve in 2024 as older contracts with low margins tail off and new contracts with more normalised margins start to contribute, says Kenanga Research.

title: KJTS to use IPO proceeds for business expansion
summary: ACE Market-bound KJTS Group Bhd aims to raise RM58.9mil from its initial public offering (IPO) at a price of 27 sen per share.
content:
PETALING JAYA: ACE Market-bound KJTS Group Bhd aims to raise RM58.9mil from its initial public offering (IPO) at a price of 27 sen per share.

The IPO of the provider of building support services comprises the issuance of 218.03 million new shares, or 31.69% of the group’s enlarged issued share capital. It is expected to have a market capitalisation of RM185.8mil upon listing on Jan 26.

title: S’pore state land sales deals hit 11-year high
summary: State land tender activity hit an 11-year high in 2023, with 14 government land sales (GLS) sites totalling S$7.7bil (US$5.78bil) being awarded.
content:
The commercial and residential site in Tampines Avenue 11 was the largest GLS deal in 2023. — The Straits Times

SINGAPORE: State land tender activity hit an 11-year high in 2023, with 14 government land sales (GLS) sites totalling S$7.7bil (US$5.78bil) being awarded.

This was the highest annual value recorded under the GLS programme since 2012, when 51 GLS sites worth S$10.6bil were awarded, according to

title: CVC may sell stake in Vietnam’s ACB
summary: CVC Capital Partners is considering selling its minority stake in Vietnam’s fourth biggest non-state owned commercial lender, Asia Commercial Bank (ACB), according to two people with knowledge of the matter.

summary:
KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 5): Here is a brief recap of some corporate announcements that made news on Friday:

Palm oil refinery builder Ecoscience International Bhd’s (EIB) wholly-owned subsidiary Ecoscience Manufacturing & Engineering Sdn Bhd is suing RDS Marketing Malaysi...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 5): Here is a brief recap of some corporate announcements that made news on Friday:

Palm oil refinery builder Ecoscience International Bhd’s (EIB) wholly-owned subsidiary Ecoscience Manufacturing & Engineering Sdn Bhd is suing RDS Marketing Malaysia Sdn Bhd to recover RM2.38 million in unpaid dues.
